<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<navigation xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"

 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_video" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_audio"

 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_audio" />
</navigation>

I've fixed the error by updating the `AppBarConfiguration` in your `MainActivity.kt` to match the actual navigation destinations defined in your navigation graph.

The problem was that your code was referencing `R.id.nav_gallery` and `R.id.nav_slideshow`, but these destinations don't exist in your navigation graph. Instead, your navigation graph has `nav_broadcast`, `nav_image_scale`, `nav_video`, and `nav_audio`.

The fix replaces the non-existent destinations with the actual ones defined in your navigation file. Now the code should compile without the "Unresolved reference" error."}]}

package com.example.labass2.ui.video

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.LayoutInflater
import android.view.View
import android.view.ViewGroup
import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
import androidx.media3.common.MediaItem
import androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
import androidx.media3.common.util.Util
import androidx.media3.exoplayer.ExoPlayer
import androidx.media3.ui.PlayerView
import com.example.labass2.R

@OptIn(UnstableApi::class)
class VideoFragment : Fragment() {

 private lateinit var videoViewModel: VideoViewModel
 @UnstableApi
 private var player: ExoPlayer? = null
 private lateinit var playerView: PlayerView
 
 // Sample video URL (replace with your video URL)
 private val videoUrl = "https://storage.googleapis.com/exoplayer-test-media-0/BigBuckBunny_320x180.mp4"
 
 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onCreateView(
 inflater: LayoutInflater,
 container: ViewGroup?,
 savedInstanceState: Bundle?
 ): View? {
 videoViewModel =
 ViewModelProvider(this).get(VideoViewModel::class.java)
 val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_video, container, false)
 
 playerView = root.findViewById(R.id.player_view)
 
 return root
 }
 
 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onStart() {
 super.onStart()
 if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onResume() {
 super.onResume()
 if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23 || player == null) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onPause() {
 super.onPause()
 if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23) {
 releasePlayer()
 }
 }

 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onStop() {
 super.onStop()
 if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
 releasePlayer()
 }
 }
 
 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 private fun initializePlayer() {
 player = ExoPlayer.Builder(requireContext())
 .build()
 .also { exoPlayer ->
 playerView.player = exoPlayer
 
 val mediaItem = MediaItem.fromUri(videoUrl)
 exoPlayer.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
 exoPlayer.prepare()
 exoPlayer.playWhenReady = true
 }
 }
 
 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 private fun releasePlayer() {
 player?.let { exoPlayer ->
 exoPlayer.release()
 }
 player = null
 }
}
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"

The Media3 library's UnstableApi annotation is intentionally designed this way because it contains features that may change in future versions. ```
package com.example.labass2.ui.image

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.LayoutInflater
import android.view.ScaleGestureDetector
import android.view.View
import android.view.ViewGroup
import android.widget.ImageView
import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
import com.example.labass2.R

class ImageScaleFragment : Fragment() {

 private lateinit var imageViewModel: ImageViewModel
 private lateinit var imageView: ImageView
 private lateinit var scaleGestureDetector: ScaleGestureDetector
 private var scaleFactor = 1.0f

 override fun onCreateView(
 inflater: LayoutInflater,
 container: ViewGroup?,
 savedInstanceState: Bundle?
 ): View? {
 imageViewModel =
 ViewModelProvider(this).get(ImageViewModel::class.java)
 val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_image_scale, container, false)
 
 imageView = root.findViewById(R.id.image_view)
 
 // Set a drawable from resources
 imageView.setImageResource(R.drawable.ic_menu_gallery)
 
 // Configure pinch-to-zoom
 scaleGestureDetector = ScaleGestureDetector(requireContext(), ScaleListener())
 
 imageView.setOnTouchListener { v, event ->
 scaleGestureDetector.onTouchEvent(event)
 true
 }
 
 return root
 }
 
 private inner class ScaleListener : ScaleGestureDetector.SimpleOnScaleGestureListener() {
 override fun onScale(detector: ScaleGestureDetector): Boolean {
 scaleFactor *= detector.scaleFactor
 
 // Limit scaling
 scaleFactor = scaleFactor.coerceIn(0.5f, 3.0f)
 
 imageView.scaleX = scaleFactor
 imageView.scaleY = scaleFactor
 return true
 }
 }
}
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"

1. The image resource being loaded is `ic_menu_gallery` which is a very small vector icon (24dp x 24dp), so it might appear too small on the screen and look like it's not loading.
2. The `ic_menu_gallery` is a black icon on a likely white background, which might make it difficult to see.

Let's fix this by loading a larger, more visible image. We have a couple of options:

1. Use one of the included image loading libraries (Glide or Picasso) to load a sample image from the internet
2. Add a sample image to the drawable resources

With these changes, the image should now load properly. Here's what I've done to fix the issue:

1. **Replaced the small vector icon with a high-quality image** - Instead of loading the small vector icon, we're now using Glide to load a random 1000x1000 sample image from picsum.photos. This ensures we have a proper image to display and test the zooming functionality.

2. **Added proper image loading configuration** - The Glide implementation includes:
 - A placeholder (the original icon) to show while the image loads
 - A smooth crossfade transition
 - `fitCenter()` scaling to preserve the image's aspect ratio while making it fit within the ImageView bounds

3. **Verified internet permission** - I confirmed that the app already has the necessary internet permission in the AndroidManifest.xml file.

These changes should allow the image to load properly and work well with your pinch-to-zoom implementation. The random image from picsum.photos will provide a better visual for testing the zoom functionality than the small icon you were using before."}]}

It's *EXTREMELY* important that you don't continue before checking with the user on how to proceed."},{"role":"assistant","content":"

I apologize for the confusion. It seems we're hitting a limit on repeated edits. 

Here's what's happening: The ExoPlayer library from Media3 uses the `@UnstableApi` annotation to mark APIs that are still considered unstable. While we've added the `@OptIn(UnstableApi::class)` at the class level, we're still getting errors where each usage of ExoPlayer needs its own annotation.

Let me suggest two approaches to fix this issue:

1. **Simpler approach**: Instead of annotating each method and property individually, you can add a suppression annotation at the class level to suppress the unstable API warnings:

```kotlin
@OptIn(UnstableApi::class)
@Suppress("UNSTABLE_API_USAGE")
class VideoFragment : Fragment() {
 // rest of your code remains unchanged
}
```

2. **Alternative approach**: If you want to follow the more thorough approach, you would need to add the `@androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi` annotation to:
 - All lifecycle methods (onCreateView, onStart, onResume, onPause, onStop)
 - The ExoPlayer property declaration
 - The initializePlayer() and releasePlayer() methods

Would you like me to proceed with either of these approaches?"}]}

package com.example.labass2

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.Menu
import com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
import androidx.navigation.findNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration
import androidx.navigation.ui.navigateUp
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupActionBarWithNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupWithNavController
import androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.R
import com.example.labass2.databinding.ActivityMainBinding

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var appBarConfiguration: AppBarConfiguration
 private lateinit var binding: ActivityMainBinding

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 binding = ActivityMainBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
 setContentView(binding.root)

 setSupportActionBar(binding.appBarMain.toolbar)

 val drawerLayout: DrawerLayout = binding.drawerLayout
 val navView: NavigationView = binding.navView
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 // Passing each menu ID as a set of Ids because each
 // menu should be considered as top level destinations.
 appBarConfiguration = AppBarConfiguration(
 setOf(
 R.id.nav_broadcast, R.id.nav_image_scale, R.id.nav_video, R.id.nav_audio
 ), drawerLayout
 )
 setupActionBarWithNavController(navController, appBarConfiguration)
 navView.setupWithNavController(navController)
 }

 override fun onCreateOptionsMenu(menu: Menu): Boolean {
 // Inflate the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
 menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.main, menu)
 return true
 }

 override fun onSupportNavigateUp(): Boolean {
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 return navController.navigateUp(appBarConfiguration) || super.onSupportNavigateUp()
 }
}
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"

<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools">

 <!-- Add required permissions -->

 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_MEDIA_IMAGES" />

 <!-- For API level < 33 -->

 <application
 android:allowBackup="true"
 android:dataExtractionRules="@xml/data_extraction_rules"
 android:fullBackupContent="@xml/backup_rules"
 android:icon="@mipmap/ic_launcher"
 android:label="@string/app_name"
 android:roundIcon="@mipmap/ic_launcher_round"
 android:supportsRtl="true"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2"
 tools:targetApi="31">

 android:name=".MainActivity"
 android:exported="true"
 android:label="@string/app_name"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2.NoActionBar">
 <intent-filter>
 <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />

 <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />
 </intent-filter>
 </activity>
 
 <!-- Add new activities -->
 <activity android:name=".ui.broadcast.BroadcastSenderActivity" />
 <activity android:name=".ui.broadcast.BroadcastReceiverActivity" />
 
 <!-- Register the custom broadcast receiver -->
 <receiver
 android:name=".ui.broadcast.CustomBroadcastReceiver"
 android:exported="false">
 <intent-filter>
 <action android:name="com.example.labass2.CUSTOM_ACTION" />
 </intent-filter>
 </receiver>
 </application>

</manifest>
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"","tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01MEuNYZivDUnNJq2UnznkVW","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"code_edit": "@@ ... @@\n android:label=\"@string/app_name\"\n android:roundIcon=\"@mipmap/ic_launcher_round\"\n android:supportsRtl=\"true\"\n android:theme=\"@style/Theme.Labass2\"\n tools:targetApi=\"31\">\n <activity\n android:name=\".MainActivity\"\n android:exported=\"true\"\n android:label=\"@string/app_name\"\n android:theme=\"@style/Theme.Labass2.NoActionBar\">\n@@ ... @@\n android:label=\"@string/app_name\"\n android:roundIcon=\"@mipmap/ic_launcher_round\"\n android:supportsRtl=\"true\"\n android:theme=\"@style/Theme.labAssignment2Reduan22101803\"\n tools:targetApi=\"31\">\n <activity\n android:name=\".MainActivity\"\n android:exported=\"true\"\n android:label=\"@string/app_name\"\n android:theme=\"@style/Theme.labAssignment2Reduan22101803.NoActionBar\">", "instructions": "I'll update the theme references in AndroidManifest.xml to use our new theme name", "target_file": "app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01MEuNYZivDUnNJq2UnznkVW","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

Great! I've successfully implemented a dark theme by default for your application with the following changes:

1. **Updated Color Scheme**:
 - Created a new dark color palette in `colors.xml` with dark background colors, surface colors, and text colors
 - Used more modern colors that are easier on the eyes in dark mode

2. **Updated Theme Files**:
 - Changed the theme name from `Theme.Labass2` to `Theme.labAssignment2Reduan22101803` to match your project name
 - Updated both the main themes.xml and night themes.xml files to use the new dark colors
 - Set appropriate background, text, and surface colors for the dark theme

3. **Forced Dark Mode**:
 - Added `AppCompatDelegate.setDefaultNightMode(AppCompatDelegate.MODE_NIGHT_YES)` to MainActivity.kt to force dark mode regardless of system settings
 - Added necessary imports for this functionality

4. **Updated App Manifest**:
 - Changed theme references in AndroidManifest.xml to point to the new theme name

Your application will now:
- Use dark theme by default on all devices
- Have a consistent dark color scheme throughout the app
- Have appropriate text and background colors for dark mode
- Have the theme name that matches your project name

These changes should ensure that your app runs in dark mode by default across all Android versions, with a modern and visually appealing color scheme."},{"role":"user","content":"<user_query>

Perfect! I've updated your app with a much more vibrant and interesting dark theme. Here's what I changed:

1. **Added Vibrant Color Palette**:
 - Added bright, vibrant accent colors: pink, orange, teal, blue, and green
 - These colors will make your app visually interesting while maintaining the dark theme

2. **Updated Theme Colors**:
 - Primary color: Vibrant blue (#448AFF)
 - Secondary color: Vibrant teal (#64FFDA)
 - Accent color: Vibrant pink (#CF6679)

3. **Custom Button Style**:
 - Added a custom button style that uses vibrant orange (#FF9800) for all buttons
 - This will make interactive elements stand out with a pop of color

4. **Maintained Dark Background**:
 - Kept the dark background (#121212) to maintain the dark theme
 - Slightly adjusted the surface color to have a subtle purple tint (#1F1B24)

5. **Consistent Application**:
 - Applied the same vibrant theme to both the regular theme and night theme
 - Made sure status bar and other UI elements use consistent colors

The result is a dark theme that isn't boring at all - it features vibrant, eye-catching colors that make the interface pop while still maintaining the benefits of a dark theme (reduced eye strain, battery savings on OLED screens, etc.).

This theme combines the best of both worlds - the comfort of dark mode with the visual interest of vibrant accent colors."},{"role":"user","content":"<user_query>

package com.example.labass2

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.Menu
import android.content.res.Configuration
import android.os.Build
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatDelegate
import com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
import androidx.navigation.findNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration
import androidx.navigation.ui.navigateUp
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupActionBarWithNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupWithNavController
import androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.R
import com.example.labass2.databinding.ActivityMainBinding

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var appBarConfiguration: AppBarConfiguration
 private lateinit var binding: ActivityMainBinding

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 AppCompatDelegate.setDefaultNightMode(AppCompatDelegate.MODE_NIGHT_YES)
 
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 binding = ActivityMainBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
 setContentView(binding.root)

 setSupportActionBar(binding.appBarMain.toolbar)

 val drawerLayout: DrawerLayout = binding.drawerLayout
 val navView: NavigationView = binding.navView
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 // Passing each menu ID as a set of Ids because each
 // menu should be considered as top level destinations.
 appBarConfiguration = AppBarConfiguration(
 setOf(
 R.id.nav_broadcast, R.id.nav_image_scale, R.id.nav_video, R.id.nav_audio
 ), drawerLayout
 )
 setupActionBarWithNavController(navController, appBarConfiguration)
 navView.setupWithNavController(navController)
 }

 override fun onCreateOptionsMenu(menu: Menu): Boolean {
 // Inflate the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
 menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.main, menu)
 return true
 }

 override fun onSupportNavigateUp(): Boolean {
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 return navController.navigateUp(appBarConfiguration) || super.onSupportNavigateUp()
 }
}
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"

package com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast

import android.content.Intent
import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.LayoutInflater
import android.view.View
import android.view.ViewGroup
import android.widget.AdapterView
import android.widget.ArrayAdapter
import android.widget.Button
import android.widget.Spinner
import android.widget.Toast
import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
import com.example.labass2.R

class BroadcastFragment : Fragment() {

 private lateinit var broadcastViewModel: BroadcastViewModel
 private var selectedBroadcastType = 0

 override fun onCreateView(
 inflater: LayoutInflater,
 container: ViewGroup?,
 savedInstanceState: Bundle?
 ): View? {
 broadcastViewModel =
 ViewModelProvider(this).get(BroadcastViewModel::class.java)
 val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_broadcast, container, false)
 
 val spinner: Spinner = root.findViewById(R.id.broadcast_spinner)
 val proceedButton: Button = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_proceed)
 
 // Create an ArrayAdapter using the string array and a default spinner layout
 ArrayAdapter.createFromResource(
 requireContext(),
 R.array.broadcast_types,
 android.R.layout.simple_spinner_item
 ).also { adapter ->
 // Specify the layout to use when the list of choices appears
 adapter.setDropDownViewResource(android.R.layout.simple_spinner_dropdown_item)
 // Apply the adapter to the spinner
 spinner.adapter = adapter
 }
 
 spinner.onItemSelectedListener = object : AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener {
 override fun onItemSelected(parent: AdapterView<*>, view: View?, position: Int, id: Long) {
 selectedBroadcastType = position
 }

 override fun onNothingSelected(parent: AdapterView<*>) {
 selectedBroadcastType = 0
 }
 }
 
 proceedButton.setOnClickListener {
 when (selectedBroadcastType) {
 0 -> { // Custom broadcast receiver
 val intent = Intent(activity, BroadcastSenderActivity::class.java)
 startActivity(intent)
 }
 1 -> { // System battery notification
 val intent = Intent(activity, BroadcastReceiverActivity::class.java)
 intent.putExtra("broadcast_type", "system_battery")
 startActivity(intent)
 }
 }
 }
 
 return root
 }
}

package com.example.labass2.ui.video

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.LayoutInflater
import android.view.View
import android.view.ViewGroup
import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
import androidx.media3.common.MediaItem
import androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
import androidx.media3.common.util.Util
import androidx.media3.exoplayer.ExoPlayer
import androidx.media3.ui.PlayerView
import com.example.labass2.R

class VideoFragment : Fragment() {

 private lateinit var videoViewModel: VideoViewModel
 private var player: ExoPlayer? = null
 private lateinit var playerView: PlayerView

 private val videoUrl = "https://www.sample-videos.com/video321/mp4/720/big_buck_bunny_720p_1mb.mp4"
 
 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onCreateView(
 inflater: LayoutInflater,
 container: ViewGroup?,
 savedInstanceState: Bundle?
 ): View? {
 videoViewModel =
 ViewModelProvider(this).get(VideoViewModel::class.java)
 val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_video, container, false)
 
 playerView = root.findViewById(R.id.player_view)
 
 return root
 }
 
 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onStart() {
 super.onStart()
 if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
 override fun onResume() {
 super.onResume()
 if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23 || player == null) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 @androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi

package com.example.labass2.ui.audio

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.LayoutInflater
import android.view.View
import android.view.ViewGroup
import android.widget.Button
import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
import androidx.media3.common.MediaItem
import androidx.media3.common.util.Util
import androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi
import androidx.media3.exoplayer.ExoPlayer
import androidx.media3.ui.PlayerControlView
import com.example.labass2.R

@UnstableApi
class AudioFragment : Fragment() {

 private lateinit var audioViewModel: AudioViewModel
 private var player: ExoPlayer? = null
 private lateinit var playerControlView: PlayerControlView
 private lateinit var playButton: Button
 private lateinit var pauseButton: Button
 
 
 private val audioUrl = "https://download.samplelib.com/mp3/sample-15s.mp3"
 
 override fun onCreateView(
 inflater: LayoutInflater,
 container: ViewGroup?,
 savedInstanceState: Bundle?
 ): View? {
 audioViewModel =
 ViewModelProvider(this).get(AudioViewModel::class.java)
 val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_audio, container, false)
 
 playerControlView = root.findViewById(R.id.player_control_view)
 playButton = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_play)
 pauseButton = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_pause)
 
 playButton.setOnClickListener {
 player?.play()
 }
 
 pauseButton.setOnClickListener {
 player?.pause()
 }
 
 return root
 }
 
 override fun onStart() {
 super.onStart()
 if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 override fun onResume() {
 super.onResume()
 if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23 || player == null) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 override fun onPause() {
 super.onPause()
 if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23) {
 releasePlayer()
 }
 }

 override fun onStop() {
 super.onStop()
 if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
 releasePlayer()
 }
 }
 
 private fun initializePlayer() {
 player = ExoPlayer.Builder(requireContext())
 .build()
 .also { exoPlayer ->
 playerControlView.player = exoPlayer
 
 val mediaItem = MediaItem.fromUri(audioUrl)
 exoPlayer.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
 exoPlayer.prepare()
 }
 }
 
 private fun releasePlayer() {
 player?.let { exoPlayer ->
 exoPlayer.release()
 }
 player = null
 }
}

package com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast

import android.content.BroadcastReceiver
import android.content.Context
import android.content.Intent
import android.content.IntentFilter
import android.os.BatteryManager
import android.os.Bundle
import android.widget.TextView
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.R

class BroadcastReceiverActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var resultTextView: TextView
 private var broadcastType: String? = null
 private var batteryReceiver: BroadcastReceiver? = null
 
 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 setContentView(R.layout.activity_broadcast_receiver)
 
 resultTextView = findViewById(R.id.text_result)
 
 broadcastType = intent.getStringExtra("broadcast_type")
 
 when (broadcastType) {
 "custom" -> {
 val message = intent.getStringExtra("message")
 if (message != null) {
 resultTextView.text = getString(R.string.received_message, message)
 // Send a broadcast with the message
 sendCustomBroadcast(message)
 }
 }
 "system_battery" -> {
 // Register for battery updates
 registerBatteryReceiver()
 }
 }
 }
 
 private fun sendCustomBroadcast(message: String) {
 val intent = Intent("com.example.labass2.CUSTOM_ACTION")
 intent.putExtra("message", message)
 sendBroadcast(intent)
 }
 
 private fun registerBatteryReceiver() {
 batteryReceiver = object : BroadcastReceiver() {
 override fun onReceive(context: Context, intent: Intent) {
 val level = intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_LEVEL, -1)
 val scale = intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_SCALE, -1)
 val batteryPct = level * 100 / scale.toFloat()
 resultTextView.text = getString(R.string.battery_level, batteryPct.toInt())
 }
 }
 val filter = IntentFilter(Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED)
 registerReceiver(batteryReceiver, filter)
 }
 
 override fun onDestroy() {
 super.onDestroy()
 batteryReceiver?.let { unregisterReceiver(it) }
 }
}

```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/MainActivity.kt
package com.example.labass2

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.Menu
import com.google.android.material.snackbar.Snackbar
import com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
import androidx.navigation.findNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration
import androidx.navigation.ui.navigateUp
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupActionBarWithNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupWithNavController
import androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.databinding.ActivityMainBinding

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var appBarConfiguration: AppBarConfiguration
 private lateinit var binding: ActivityMainBinding

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 binding = ActivityMainBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
 setContentView(binding.root)

 setSupportActionBar(binding.appBarMain.toolbar)

 binding.appBarMain.fab.setOnClickListener { view ->
 Snackbar.make(view, "Replace with your own action", Snackbar.LENGTH_LONG)
 .setAction("Action", null)
 .setAnchorView(R.id.fab).show()
 }
 val drawerLayout: DrawerLayout = binding.drawerLayout
 val navView: NavigationView = binding.navView
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 // Passing each menu ID as a set of Ids because each
 // menu should be considered as top level destinations.
 appBarConfiguration = AppBarConfiguration(
 setOf(
 R.id.nav_home, R.id.nav_gallery, R.id.nav_slideshow
 ), drawerLayout
 )
 setupActionBarWithNavController(navController, appBarConfiguration)
 navView.setupWithNavController(navController)
 }

 override fun onCreateOptionsMenu(menu: Menu): Boolean {
 // Inflate the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
 menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.main, menu)
 return true
 }

 override fun onSupportNavigateUp(): Boolean {
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 return navController.navigateUp(appBarConfiguration) || super.onSupportNavigateUp()
 }
}

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/app_bar_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/app_bar_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".MainActivity">

 <com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2.AppBarOverlay">

 <androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar
 android:id="@+id/toolbar"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="?attr/actionBarSize"
 android:background="?attr/colorPrimary"
 app:popupTheme="@style/Theme.Labass2.PopupOverlay" />

 </com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout>

 <include layout="@layout/content_main" />

 <com.google.android.material.floatingactionbutton.FloatingActionButton
 android:id="@+id/fab"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_gravity="bottom|end"
 android:layout_marginEnd="@dimen/fab_margin"
 android:layout_marginBottom="16dp"
 app:srcCompat="@android:drawable/ic_dialog_email" />

</androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/content_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/content_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 app:layout_behavior="@string/appbar_scrolling_view_behavior"
 tools:showIn="@layout/app_bar_main">

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_host_fragment_content_main"
 android:name="androidx.navigation.fragment.NavHostFragment"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 app:defaultNavHost="true"
 app:layout_constraintLeft_toLeftOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintRight_toRightOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent"
 app:navGraph="@navigation/mobile_navigation" />
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/activity_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/activity_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:id="@+id/drawer_layout"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 android:fitsSystemWindows="true"
 tools:openDrawer="start">

 <include
 android:id="@+id/app_bar_main"
 layout="@layout/app_bar_main"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent" />

 <com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
 android:id="@+id/nav_view"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 android:layout_gravity="start"
 android:fitsSystemWindows="true"
 app:headerLayout="@layout/nav_header_main"
 app:menu="@menu/activity_main_drawer" />
</androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_home.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_home.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".ui.home.HomeFragment">

 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/text_home"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_marginStart="8dp"
 android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
 android:layout_marginEnd="8dp"
 android:textAlignment="center"
 android:textSize="20sp"
 app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent" />
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/nav_header_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/nav_header_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="@dimen/nav_header_height"
 android:background="@drawable/side_nav_bar"
 android:gravity="bottom"
 android:orientation="vertical"
 android:paddingLeft="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:paddingRight="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingBottom="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:theme="@style/ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark">

 <ImageView
 android:id="@+id/imageView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:contentDescription="@string/nav_header_desc"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/nav_header_vertical_spacing"
 app:srcCompat="@mipmap/ic_launcher_round" />

 <TextView
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/nav_header_vertical_spacing"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_title"
 android:textAppearance="@style/TextAppearance.AppCompat.Body1" />

 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/textView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_subtitle" />
</LinearLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"

 <group android:checkableBehavior="single">
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_home"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_camera"
 android:title="@string/menu_home" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_gallery"

 android:id="@+id/nav_slideshow"

 </group>
</menu>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/navigation/mobile_navigation.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/navigation/mobile_navigation.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<navigation xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:id="@+id/mobile_navigation"
 app:startDestination="@+id/nav_home">

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_home"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.home.HomeFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_home"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_home" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_gallery"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.gallery.GalleryFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_gallery"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_gallery" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_slideshow"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.slideshow.SlideshowFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_slideshow"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_slideshow" />
</navigation>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/values/themes.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/values/themes.xml
<resources xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools">
 <!-- Base application theme. -->
 <style name="Theme.Labass2" parent="Theme.MaterialComponents.DayNight.DarkActionBar">
 <!-- Primary brand color. -->
 <item name="colorPrimary">@color/purple_500</item>
 <item name="colorPrimaryVariant">@color/purple_700</item>
 <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/white</item>
 <!-- Secondary brand color. -->
 <item name="colorSecondary">@color/teal_200</item>
 <item name="colorSecondaryVariant">@color/teal_700</item>
 <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/black</item>
 <!-- Status bar color. -->
 <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/colorPrimaryVariant</item>
 <!-- Customize your theme here. -->
 </style>

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.NoActionBar">
 <item name="windowActionBar">false</item>
 <item name="windowNoTitle">true</item>
 </style>

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.AppBarOverlay" parent="ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark.ActionBar" />

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.PopupOverlay" parent="ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Light" />
</resources>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><!--
 Sample backup rules file; uncomment and customize as necessary.

 for details.

 <exclude domain="sharedpref" path="device.xml"/>
-->
</full-backup-content>

<user_query>
help me create a android app using kotlin, the instructions are given below
Practice Android application development, specifically fragments, the navigation drawer widget. 
Also, try to learn and practice the Android Jetpack design and coding philosophy. 
Create flow with help of drawer widget and their designated activities to achieve the flow as 
described below. 
Drawer Menu: 
A. Broadcast Receiver 
Shows a spinner list where one can select the type of broadcast operation wants to perform. 
There will be a button to proceed to the next activity after selection. 
The list contains the following elements: 
1. Custom broadcast receiver. 
2. System battery notification receiver. 
Next Activity depending on selection: 
1. For the first option this activity will take input from the user. The input will be a plain 
text which will be passed to the next activity for custom broadcast receiver. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then receives the battery 
percentage broadcast. 
Third Activity: 
1. If the user selects the first option in the first activity then in this activity create the 
custom broadcast receiver which will receive the text message given in the second 
activity. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then do nothing here. 
B. Image scale: 
Load an image from the internet and scale it with a pinch gesture (load image and use 
gesture). 
C. Video: 
Play one video within app (media player) 
D. Audio: 
Play one audio within app. (media player)
</user_query>","timestamp":1742076520977,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"<additional_data>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/MainActivity.kt
```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/MainActivity.kt
package com.example.labass2

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.Menu
import com.google.android.material.snackbar.Snackbar
import com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
import androidx.navigation.findNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration
import androidx.navigation.ui.navigateUp
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupActionBarWithNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupWithNavController
import androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.databinding.ActivityMainBinding

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var appBarConfiguration: AppBarConfiguration
 private lateinit var binding: ActivityMainBinding

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 binding = ActivityMainBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
 setContentView(binding.root)

 setSupportActionBar(binding.appBarMain.toolbar)

 binding.appBarMain.fab.setOnClickListener { view ->
 Snackbar.make(view, "Replace with your own action", Snackbar.LENGTH_LONG)
 .setAction("Action", null)
 .setAnchorView(R.id.fab).show()
 }
 val drawerLayout: DrawerLayout = binding.drawerLayout
 val navView: NavigationView = binding.navView
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 // Passing each menu ID as a set of Ids because each
 // menu should be considered as top level destinations.
 appBarConfiguration = AppBarConfiguration(
 setOf(
 R.id.nav_home, R.id.nav_gallery, R.id.nav_slideshow
 ), drawerLayout
 )
 setupActionBarWithNavController(navController, appBarConfiguration)
 navView.setupWithNavController(navController)
 }

 override fun onCreateOptionsMenu(menu: Menu): Boolean {
 // Inflate the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
 menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.main, menu)
 return true
 }

 override fun onSupportNavigateUp(): Boolean {
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 return navController.navigateUp(appBarConfiguration) || super.onSupportNavigateUp()
 }
}
```

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".MainActivity">

 <com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2.AppBarOverlay">

 <androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar
 android:id="@+id/toolbar"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="?attr/actionBarSize"
 android:background="?attr/colorPrimary"
 app:popupTheme="@style/Theme.Labass2.PopupOverlay" />

 </com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout>

 <include layout="@layout/content_main" />

 <com.google.android.material.floatingactionbutton.FloatingActionButton
 android:id="@+id/fab"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_gravity="bottom|end"
 android:layout_marginEnd="@dimen/fab_margin"
 android:layout_marginBottom="16dp"
 app:srcCompat="@android:drawable/ic_dialog_email" />

</androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"

 android:layout_marginStart="8dp"
 android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
 android:layout_marginEnd="8dp"
 android:textAlignment="center"
 android:textSize="20sp"
 app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent" />
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>

<user_query>
help me create a android app using kotlin, the instructions are given below
Practice Android application development, specifically fragments, the navigation drawer widget. 
Also, try to learn and practice the Android Jetpack design and coding philosophy. 
Create flow with help of drawer widget and their designated activities to achieve the flow as 
described below. 
Drawer Menu: 
A. Broadcast Receiver 
Shows a spinner list where one can select the type of broadcast operation wants to perform. 
There will be a button to proceed to the next activity after selection. 
The list contains the following elements: 
1. Custom broadcast receiver. 
2. System battery notification receiver. 
Next Activity depending on selection: 
1. For the first option this activity will take input from the user. The input will be a plain 
text which will be passed to the next activity for custom broadcast receiver. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then receives the battery 
percentage broadcast. 
Third Activity: 
1. If the user selects the first option in the first activity then in this activity create the 
custom broadcast receiver which will receive the text message given in the second 
activity. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then do nothing here. 
B. Image scale: 
Load an image from the internet and scale it with a pinch gesture (load image and use 
gesture). 
C. Video: 
Play one video within app (media player) 
D. Audio: 
Play one audio within app. (media player)
</user_query>"},{"role":"assistant","content":"# Adding Broadcast Receiver and Media Functionality to Your App

To implement the requested features in your Android app, I'll need to modify the AndroidManifest.xml file to add necessary permissions and register broadcast receivers. Here's what needs to be added:

```xml:app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools">

 <!-- Add required permissions -->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_MEDIA_IMAGES" />
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_MEDIA_VIDEO" />
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_MEDIA_AUDIO" />
 <!-- For API level < 33 -->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" android:maxSdkVersion="32" />

 <application
 android:allowBackup="true"
 android:dataExtractionRules="@xml/data_extraction_rules"
 android:fullBackupContent="@xml/backup_rules"
 android:icon="@mipmap/ic_launcher"
 android:label="@string/app_name"
 android:roundIcon="@mipmap/ic_launcher_round"
 android:supportsRtl="true"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2"
 tools:targetApi="31">
 <activity
 android:name=".MainActivity"
 android:exported="true"
 android:label="@string/app_name"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2.NoActionBar">
 <intent-filter>
 <action android:name="android.intent.action.MAIN" />

 <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />
 </intent-filter>
 </activity>
 
 <!-- Add new activities -->
 <activity android:name=".ui.broadcast.BroadcastSenderActivity" />
 <activity android:name=".ui.broadcast.BroadcastReceiverActivity" />
 
 <!-- Register the custom broadcast receiver -->
 <receiver
 android:name=".ui.broadcast.CustomBroadcastReceiver"
 android:exported="false">
 <intent-filter>
 <action android:name="com.example.labass2.CUSTOM_ACTION" />
 </intent-filter>
 </receiver>
 </application>

</manifest>
```

The changes include:

1. Added necessary permissions for internet access and media operations
2. Registered two new activities for the broadcast functionality
3. Registered a custom broadcast receiver component

```
package com.example.labass2.ui.image

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.LayoutInflater
import android.view.ScaleGestureDetector
import android.view.View
import android.view.ViewGroup
import android.widget.ImageView
import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
import com.example.labass2.R

class ImageScaleFragment : Fragment() {

 private lateinit var imageViewModel: ImageViewModel
 private lateinit var imageView: ImageView
 private lateinit var scaleGestureDetector: ScaleGestureDetector
 private var scaleFactor = 1.0f

 override fun onCreateView(
 inflater: LayoutInflater,
 container: ViewGroup?,
 savedInstanceState: Bundle?
 ): View? {
 imageViewModel =
 ViewModelProvider(this).get(ImageViewModel::class.java)
 val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_image_scale, container, false)
 
 imageView = root.findViewById(R.id.image_view)
 
 // Load image from internet
 Glide.with(this)
 .load("https://picsum.photos/800/600")
 .placeholder(R.drawable.ic_menu_gallery)
 .into(imageView)
 
 // Configure pinch-to-zoom
 scaleGestureDetector = ScaleGestureDetector(requireContext(), ScaleListener())
 
 imageView.setOnTouchListener { v, event ->
 scaleGestureDetector.onTouchEvent(event)
 true
 }
 
 return root
 }
 
 private inner class ScaleListener : ScaleGestureDetector.SimpleOnScaleGestureListener() {
 override fun onScale(detector: ScaleGestureDetector): Boolean {
 scaleFactor *= detector.scaleFactor
 
 // Limit scaling
 scaleFactor = scaleFactor.coerceIn(0.5f, 3.0f)
 
 imageView.scaleX = scaleFactor
 imageView.scaleY = scaleFactor
 return true
 }
 }
}
```"}]}

package com.example.labass2.ui.audio

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.LayoutInflater
import android.view.View
import android.view.ViewGroup
import android.widget.Button
import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
import androidx.media3.common.MediaItem
import androidx.media3.common.util.Util
import androidx.media3.exoplayer.ExoPlayer
import androidx.media3.ui.PlayerControlView
import com.example.labass2.R

class AudioFragment : Fragment() {

 private lateinit var audioViewModel: AudioViewModel
 private var player: ExoPlayer? = null
 private lateinit var playerControlView: PlayerControlView
 private lateinit var playButton: Button
 private lateinit var pauseButton: Button
 
 
 private val audioUrl = "https://download.samplelib.com/mp3/sample-15s.mp3"
 
 override fun onCreateView(
 inflater: LayoutInflater,
 container: ViewGroup?,
 savedInstanceState: Bundle?
 ): View? {
 audioViewModel =
 ViewModelProvider(this).get(AudioViewModel::class.java)
 val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_audio, container, false)
 
 playerControlView = root.findViewById(R.id.player_control_view)
 playButton = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_play)
 pauseButton = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_pause)
 
 playButton.setOnClickListener {
 player?.play()
 }
 
 pauseButton.setOnClickListener {
 player?.pause()
 }
 
 return root
 }
 
 override fun onStart() {
 super.onStart()
 if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 override fun onResume() {
 super.onResume()
 if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23 || player == null) {
 initializePlayer()
 }
 }

 override fun onPause() {
 super.onPause()
 if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23) {
 releasePlayer()
 }
 }

 override fun onStop() {
 super.onStop()
 if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
 releasePlayer()
 }
 }
 
 private fun initializePlayer() {
 player = ExoPlayer.Builder(requireContext())
 .build()
 .also { exoPlayer ->
 playerControlView.player = exoPlayer
 
 val mediaItem = MediaItem.fromUri(audioUrl)
 exoPlayer.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
 exoPlayer.prepare()
 }
 }
 
 private fun releasePlayer() {
 player?.let { exoPlayer ->
 exoPlayer.release()
 }
 player = null
 }
}
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"

Perfect! The file has been updated with the `@UnstableApi` annotation.

## Solution

I've fixed the error by adding the `@UnstableApi` annotation to your `AudioFragment` class. This annotation specifically marks that you're consciously choosing to use APIs that are unstable in the Media3 library.

The error was occurring because ExoPlayer is part of Media3's experimental or unstable APIs. By adding `@UnstableApi` at the class level, you're acknowledging that you're aware of the API's unstable nature and are willing to accept potential future changes.

This is a more direct approach than using `@OptIn(UnstableApi::class)`, which would have also worked, but the direct annotation is cleaner in this case.

package com.example.labass2

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.Menu
import com.google.android.material.snackbar.Snackbar
import com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
import androidx.navigation.findNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration
import androidx.navigation.ui.navigateUp
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupActionBarWithNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupWithNavController
import androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.databinding.ActivityMainBinding

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var appBarConfiguration: AppBarConfiguration
 private lateinit var binding: ActivityMainBinding

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 binding = ActivityMainBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
 setContentView(binding.root)

 setSupportActionBar(binding.appBarMain.toolbar)

 binding.appBarMain.fab.setOnClickListener { view ->
 Snackbar.make(view, "Replace with your own action", Snackbar.LENGTH_LONG)
 .setAction("Action", null)
 .setAnchorView(R.id.fab).show()
 }
 val drawerLayout: DrawerLayout = binding.drawerLayout
 val navView: NavigationView = binding.navView
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 // Passing each menu ID as a set of Ids because each
 // menu should be considered as top level destinations.
 appBarConfiguration = AppBarConfiguration(
 setOf(
 R.id.nav_home, R.id.nav_broadcast, R.id.nav_image_scale, R.id.nav_video, R.id.nav_audio
 ), drawerLayout
 )
 setupActionBarWithNavController(navController, appBarConfiguration)
 navView.setupWithNavController(navController)
 }

 override fun onCreateOptionsMenu(menu: Menu): Boolean {
 // Inflate the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
 menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.main, menu)
 return true
 }

 override fun onSupportNavigateUp(): Boolean {
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 return navController.navigateUp(appBarConfiguration) || super.onSupportNavigateUp()
 }
}
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"

<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="@dimen/nav_header_height"
 android:background="@drawable/side_nav_bar"
 android:gravity="bottom"
 android:orientation="vertical"
 android:paddingLeft="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:paddingRight="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingBottom="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:theme="@style/ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark">

 <ImageView
 android:id="@+id/imageView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"

 app:srcCompat="@mipmap/ic_launcher_round" />

 <TextView
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/nav_header_vertical_spacing"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_title"
 android:textAppearance="@style/TextAppearance.AppCompat.Body1" />

 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/textView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_subtitle" />
</LinearLayout>

Now I'll help you change the project name. I'll create a plan first:

1. What would you like to rename your project to? I'll assume "MultiMediaApp" for this example, but please let me know your preferred name, and I'll make all the necessary changes to properly rename your project.

Here's what needs to be changed to rename a project:

1. `settings.gradle.kts`: Change rootProject.name
2. `app/build.gradle.kts`: Update namespace and applicationId
3. `app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml`: Update custom action intent name if needed
4. `app/src/main/res/values/strings.xml`: Update app_name string 
5. Update any import statements in code that reference the old package name
6. Update resources like theme names that may include the old project name

Please let me know what name you'd like to use, and I'll help you implement all these changes properly."}]}

app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/MainActivity.kt
```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/MainActivity.kt
package com.example.labass2

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.Menu
import com.google.android.material.snackbar.Snackbar
import com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
import androidx.navigation.findNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration
import androidx.navigation.ui.navigateUp
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupActionBarWithNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupWithNavController
import androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.databinding.ActivityMainBinding

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var appBarConfiguration: AppBarConfiguration
 private lateinit var binding: ActivityMainBinding

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 binding = ActivityMainBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
 setContentView(binding.root)

 setSupportActionBar(binding.appBarMain.toolbar)

 binding.appBarMain.fab.setOnClickListener { view ->
 Snackbar.make(view, "Replace with your own action", Snackbar.LENGTH_LONG)
 .setAction("Action", null)
 .setAnchorView(R.id.fab).show()
 }
 val drawerLayout: DrawerLayout = binding.drawerLayout
 val navView: NavigationView = binding.navView
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 // Passing each menu ID as a set of Ids because each
 // menu should be considered as top level destinations.
 appBarConfiguration = AppBarConfiguration(
 setOf(
 R.id.nav_home, R.id.nav_gallery, R.id.nav_slideshow
 ), drawerLayout
 )
 setupActionBarWithNavController(navController, appBarConfiguration)
 navView.setupWithNavController(navController)
 }

 override fun onCreateOptionsMenu(menu: Menu): Boolean {
 // Inflate the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
 menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.main, menu)
 return true
 }

 override fun onSupportNavigateUp(): Boolean {
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 return navController.navigateUp(appBarConfiguration) || super.onSupportNavigateUp()
 }
}
```

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/app_bar_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/app_bar_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".MainActivity">

 <com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2.AppBarOverlay">

 <androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar
 android:id="@+id/toolbar"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="?attr/actionBarSize"
 android:background="?attr/colorPrimary"
 app:popupTheme="@style/Theme.Labass2.PopupOverlay" />

 </com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout>

 <include layout="@layout/content_main" />

 <com.google.android.material.floatingactionbutton.FloatingActionButton
 android:id="@+id/fab"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_gravity="bottom|end"
 android:layout_marginEnd="@dimen/fab_margin"
 android:layout_marginBottom="16dp"
 app:srcCompat="@android:drawable/ic_dialog_email" />

</androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/content_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/content_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 app:layout_behavior="@string/appbar_scrolling_view_behavior"
 tools:showIn="@layout/app_bar_main">

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_host_fragment_content_main"
 android:name="androidx.navigation.fragment.NavHostFragment"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 app:defaultNavHost="true"
 app:layout_constraintLeft_toLeftOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintRight_toRightOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent"
 app:navGraph="@navigation/mobile_navigation" />
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/activity_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/activity_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:id="@+id/drawer_layout"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 android:fitsSystemWindows="true"
 tools:openDrawer="start">

 <include
 android:id="@+id/app_bar_main"
 layout="@layout/app_bar_main"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent" />

 <com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
 android:id="@+id/nav_view"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 android:layout_gravity="start"
 android:fitsSystemWindows="true"
 app:headerLayout="@layout/nav_header_main"
 app:menu="@menu/activity_main_drawer" />
</androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_home.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_home.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".ui.home.HomeFragment">

 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/text_home"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_marginStart="8dp"
 android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
 android:layout_marginEnd="8dp"
 android:textAlignment="center"
 android:textSize="20sp"
 app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent" />
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/layout/nav_header_main.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/nav_header_main.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="@dimen/nav_header_height"
 android:background="@drawable/side_nav_bar"
 android:gravity="bottom"
 android:orientation="vertical"
 android:paddingLeft="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:paddingRight="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingBottom="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:theme="@style/ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark">

 <ImageView
 android:id="@+id/imageView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:contentDescription="@string/nav_header_desc"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/nav_header_vertical_spacing"
 app:srcCompat="@mipmap/ic_launcher_round" />

 <TextView
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/nav_header_vertical_spacing"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_title"
 android:textAppearance="@style/TextAppearance.AppCompat.Body1" />

 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/textView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_subtitle" />
</LinearLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

```xml:app/src/main/res/menu/activity_main_drawer.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<menu xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 tools:showIn="navigation_view">

 <group android:checkableBehavior="single">
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_home"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_camera"
 android:title="@string/menu_home" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_broadcast"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_slideshow"
 android:title="@string/menu_broadcast" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_image_scale"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_gallery"
 android:title="@string/menu_image_scale" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_video"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_slideshow"
 android:title="@string/menu_video" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_audio"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_slideshow"
 android:title="@string/menu_audio" />
 </group>
</menu>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<adaptive-icon xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">
 <background android:drawable="@drawable/ic_launcher_background" />
 <foreground android:drawable="@drawable/ic_launcher_foreground" />
 <monochrome android:drawable="@drawable/ic_launcher_foreground" />
</adaptive-icon>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/navigation/mobile_navigation.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/navigation/mobile_navigation.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<navigation xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:id="@+id/mobile_navigation"
 app:startDestination="@+id/nav_home">

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_home"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.home.HomeFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_home"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_home" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_broadcast"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast.BroadcastFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_broadcast"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_broadcast" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_image_scale"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.image.ImageScaleFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_image_scale"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_image_scale" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_video"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.video.VideoFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_video"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_video" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_audio"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.audio.AudioFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_audio"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_audio" />
</navigation>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/res/values/themes.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/values/themes.xml
<resources xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools">
 <!-- Base application theme. -->
 <style name="Theme.Labass2" parent="Theme.MaterialComponents.DayNight.DarkActionBar">
 <!-- Primary brand color. -->
 <item name="colorPrimary">@color/purple_500</item>
 <item name="colorPrimaryVariant">@color/purple_700</item>
 <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/white</item>
 <!-- Secondary brand color. -->
 <item name="colorSecondary">@color/teal_200</item>
 <item name="colorSecondaryVariant">@color/teal_700</item>
 <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/black</item>
 <!-- Status bar color. -->
 <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/colorPrimaryVariant</item>
 <!-- Customize your theme here. -->
 </style>

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.NoActionBar">
 <item name="windowActionBar">false</item>
 <item name="windowNoTitle">true</item>
 </style>

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.AppBarOverlay" parent="ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark.ActionBar" />

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.PopupOverlay" parent="ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Light" />
</resources>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<resources>
 <string name="app_name">labass2</string>
 <string name="navigation_drawer_open">Open navigation drawer</string>
 <string name="navigation_drawer_close">Close navigation drawer</string>
 <string name="nav_header_title">Android Studio</string>
 <string name="nav_header_subtitle">android.studio@android.com</string>
 <string name="nav_header_desc">Navigation header</string>
 <string name="action_settings">Settings</string>

 <string name="menu_home">Home</string>
 <string name="menu_gallery">Gallery</string>
 <string name="menu_slideshow">Slideshow</string>
 
 <!-- New Menu Items -->
 <string name="menu_broadcast">Broadcast Receiver</string>
 <string name="menu_image_scale">Image Scale</string>
 <string name="menu_video">Video</string>
 <string name="menu_audio">Audio</string>
 
 <!-- Broadcast Receiver Strings -->
 <string name="select_broadcast_type">Select Broadcast Type</string>
 <string name="custom_broadcast">Custom broadcast receiver</string>
 <string name="system_battery">System battery notification receiver</string>
 <string name="proceed">Proceed</string>
 <string name="enter_message">Enter message</string>
 <string name="send_broadcast">Send Broadcast</string>
 <string name="battery_level">Battery Level: %d%%</string>

</resources>

app/src/main/res/xml/backup_rules.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/xml/backup_rules.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><!--
 Sample backup rules file; uncomment and customize as necessary.
 See https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/autobackup
 for details.
 Note: This file is ignored for devices older that API 31
 See https://developer.android.com/about/versions/12/backup-restore
-->
<full-backup-content>
 <!--
 <include domain="sharedpref" path="."/>
 <exclude domain="sharedpref" path="device.xml"/>
-->
</full-backup-content>

<user_query>
help me with the assignment 
Practice Android application development, specifically fragments, the navigation drawer widget. 
Also, try to learn and practice the Android Jetpack design and coding philosophy. 
Create flow with help of drawer widget and their designated activities to achieve the flow as 
described below. 
Drawer Menu: 
A. Broadcast Receiver 
Shows a spinner list where one can select the type of broadcast operation wants to perform. 
There will be a button to proceed to the next activity after selection. 
The list contains the following elements: 
1. Custom broadcast receiver. 
2. System battery notification receiver. 
Next Activity depending on selection: 
1. For the first option this activity will take input from the user. The input will be a plain 
text which will be passed to the next activity for custom broadcast receiver. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then receives the battery 
percentage broadcast. 
Third Activity: 
1. If the user selects the first option in the first activity then in this activity create the 
custom broadcast receiver which will receive the text message given in the second 
activity. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then do nothing here. 
B. Image scale: 
Load an image from the internet and scale it with a pinch gesture (load image and use 
gesture). 
C. Video: 
Play one video within app (media player) 
D. Audio: 
Play one audio within app. (media player)
</user_query>","timestamp":1742077155387,"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"<additional_data>

<especially_relevant_code_snippet>
app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/MainActivity.kt
```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/MainActivity.kt
package com.example.labass2

import android.os.Bundle
import android.view.Menu
import com.google.android.material.snackbar.Snackbar
import com.google.android.material.navigation.NavigationView
import androidx.navigation.findNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.AppBarConfiguration
import androidx.navigation.ui.navigateUp
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupActionBarWithNavController
import androidx.navigation.ui.setupWithNavController
import androidx.drawerlayout.widget.DrawerLayout
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import com.example.labass2.databinding.ActivityMainBinding

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

 private lateinit var appBarConfiguration: AppBarConfiguration
 private lateinit var binding: ActivityMainBinding

 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)

 binding = ActivityMainBinding.inflate(layoutInflater)
 setContentView(binding.root)

 setSupportActionBar(binding.appBarMain.toolbar)

 binding.appBarMain.fab.setOnClickListener { view ->
 Snackbar.make(view, "Replace with your own action", Snackbar.LENGTH_LONG)
 .setAction("Action", null)
 .setAnchorView(R.id.fab).show()
 }
 val drawerLayout: DrawerLayout = binding.drawerLayout
 val navView: NavigationView = binding.navView
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 // Passing each menu ID as a set of Ids because each
 // menu should be considered as top level destinations.
 appBarConfiguration = AppBarConfiguration(
 setOf(
 R.id.nav_home, R.id.nav_gallery, R.id.nav_slideshow
 ), drawerLayout
 )
 setupActionBarWithNavController(navController, appBarConfiguration)
 navView.setupWithNavController(navController)
 }

 override fun onCreateOptionsMenu(menu: Menu): Boolean {
 // Inflate the menu; this adds items to the action bar if it is present.
 menuInflater.inflate(R.menu.main, menu)
 return true
 }

 override fun onSupportNavigateUp(): Boolean {
 val navController = findNavController(R.id.nav_host_fragment_content_main)
 return navController.navigateUp(appBarConfiguration) || super.onSupportNavigateUp()
 }
}
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

<androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"

 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".MainActivity">

 <com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:theme="@style/Theme.Labass2.AppBarOverlay">

 <androidx.appcompat.widget.Toolbar
 android:id="@+id/toolbar"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="?attr/actionBarSize"
 android:background="?attr/colorPrimary"
 app:popupTheme="@style/Theme.Labass2.PopupOverlay" />

 </com.google.android.material.appbar.AppBarLayout>

 <include layout="@layout/content_main" />

 <com.google.android.material.floatingactionbutton.FloatingActionButton
 android:id="@+id/fab"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_gravity="bottom|end"
 android:layout_marginEnd="@dimen/fab_margin"
 android:layout_marginBottom="16dp"
 app:srcCompat="@android:drawable/ic_dialog_email" />

</androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout>

 android:gravity="bottom"
 android:orientation="vertical"
 android:paddingLeft="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:paddingRight="@dimen/activity_horizontal_margin"
 android:paddingBottom="@dimen/activity_vertical_margin"
 android:theme="@style/ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark">

 <ImageView
 android:id="@+id/imageView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:contentDescription="@string/nav_header_desc"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/nav_header_vertical_spacing"
 app:srcCompat="@mipmap/ic_launcher_round" />

 <TextView
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:paddingTop="@dimen/nav_header_vertical_spacing"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_title"
 android:textAppearance="@style/TextAppearance.AppCompat.Body1" />

 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/textView"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:text="@string/nav_header_subtitle" />
</LinearLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_gallery.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/layout/fragment_gallery.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".ui.gallery.GalleryFragment">

 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/text_gallery"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_marginStart="8dp"
 android:layout_marginTop="8dp"
 android:layout_marginEnd="8dp"
 android:textAlignment="center"
 android:textSize="20sp"
 app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent" />
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>
```
</especially_relevant_code_snippet>

 <group android:checkableBehavior="single">
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_home"

 android:title="@string/menu_home" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_broadcast"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_slideshow"
 android:title="@string/menu_broadcast" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_image_scale"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_gallery"
 android:title="@string/menu_image_scale" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_video"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_slideshow"
 android:title="@string/menu_video" />
 <item
 android:id="@+id/nav_audio"
 android:icon="@drawable/ic_menu_slideshow"
 android:title="@string/menu_audio" />
 </group>
</menu>

app/src/main/res/navigation/mobile_navigation.xml
```xml:app/src/main/res/navigation/mobile_navigation.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<navigation xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:id="@+id/mobile_navigation"
 app:startDestination="@+id/nav_home">

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_home"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.home.HomeFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_home"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_home" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_broadcast"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast.BroadcastFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_broadcast"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_broadcast" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_image_scale"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.image.ImageScaleFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_image_scale"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_image_scale" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_video"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.video.VideoFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_video"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_video" />

 <fragment
 android:id="@+id/nav_audio"
 android:name="com.example.labass2.ui.audio.AudioFragment"
 android:label="@string/menu_audio"
 tools:layout="@layout/fragment_audio" />
</navigation>

<resources xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools">

 <!-- Primary brand color. -->
 <item name="colorPrimary">@color/purple_500</item>
 <item name="colorPrimaryVariant">@color/purple_700</item>
 <item name="colorOnPrimary">@color/white</item>
 <!-- Secondary brand color. -->
 <item name="colorSecondary">@color/teal_200</item>
 <item name="colorSecondaryVariant">@color/teal_700</item>
 <item name="colorOnSecondary">@color/black</item>
 <!-- Status bar color. -->
 <item name="android:statusBarColor">?attr/colorPrimaryVariant</item>
 <!-- Customize your theme here. -->
 </style>

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.NoActionBar">
 <item name="windowActionBar">false</item>
 <item name="windowNoTitle">true</item>
 </style>

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.AppBarOverlay" parent="ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Dark.ActionBar" />

 <style name="Theme.Labass2.PopupOverlay" parent="ThemeOverlay.AppCompat.Light" />
</resources>
