<user_query>
help me with the assignment 
Practice Android application development, specifically fragments, the navigation drawer widget. 
Also, try to learn and practice the Android Jetpack design and coding philosophy. 
Create flow with help of drawer widget and their designated activities to achieve the flow as 
described below. 
Drawer Menu: 
A. Broadcast Receiver 
Shows a spinner list where one can select the type of broadcast operation wants to perform. 
There will be a button to proceed to the next activity after selection. 
The list contains the following elements: 
1. Custom broadcast receiver. 
2. System battery notification receiver. 
Next Activity depending on selection: 
1. For the first option this activity will take input from the user. The input will be a plain 
text which will be passed to the next activity for custom broadcast receiver. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then receives the battery 
percentage broadcast. 
Third Activity: 
1. If the user selects the first option in the first activity then in this activity create the 
custom broadcast receiver which will receive the text message given in the second 
activity. 
2. If the user selects the second option in the first activity then do nothing here. 
B. Image scale: 
Load an image from the internet and scale it with a pinch gesture (load image and use 
gesture). 
C. Video: 
Play one video within app (media player) 
D. Audio: 
Play one audio within app. (media player)
</user_query>"},{"role":"assistant","content":"I'll help you implement this Android application assignment that involves fragments, navigation drawer, and various Android components. Let's break this down into manageable steps.

{\n broadcastViewModel =\n ViewModelProvider(this).get(BroadcastViewModel::class.java)\n val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_broadcast, container, false)\n \n val spinner: Spinner = root.findViewById(R.id.broadcast_spinner)\n val proceedButton: Button = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_proceed)\n \n // Create an ArrayAdapter using the string array and a default spinner layout\n ArrayAdapter.createFromResource(\n requireContext(),\n R.array.broadcast_types,\n android.R.layout.simple_spinner_item\n ).also { adapter ->\n // Specify the layout to use when the list of choices appears\n adapter.setDropDownViewResource(android.R.layout.simple_spinner_dropdown_item)\n // Apply the adapter to the spinner\n spinner.adapter = adapter\n }\n \n spinner.onItemSelectedListener = object : AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener {\n override fun onItemSelected(parent: AdapterView<*>, view: View?, position: Int, id: Long) {\n selectedBroadcastType = position\n }\n\n override fun onNothingSelected(parent: AdapterView<*>) {\n selectedBroadcastType = 0\n }\n }\n \n proceedButton.setOnClickListener {\n when (selectedBroadcastType) {\n 0 -> { // Custom broadcast receiver\n val intent = Intent(activity, BroadcastSenderActivity::class.java)\n startActivity(intent)\n }\n 1 -> { // System battery notification\n val intent = Intent(activity, BroadcastReceiverActivity::class.java)\n intent.putExtra(\"broadcast_type\", \"system_battery\")\n startActivity(intent)\n }\n }\n }\n \n return root\n }\n}"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01SRb1GR8R5njP9bgewk6146","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,1 +1,72 @@
+package com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast
 
+import android.content.Intent
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import android.view.ViewGroup
+import android.widget.AdapterView
+import android.widget.ArrayAdapter
+import android.widget.Button
+import android.widget.Spinner
+import android.widget.Toast
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
+import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
+import com.example.labass2.R
+
+class BroadcastFragment : Fragment() {
+
+ private lateinit var broadcastViewModel: BroadcastViewModel
+ private var selectedBroadcastType = 0
+
+ override fun onCreateView(
+ inflater: LayoutInflater,
+ container: ViewGroup?,
+ savedInstanceState: Bundle?
+ ): View? {
+ broadcastViewModel =
+ ViewModelProvider(this).get(BroadcastViewModel::class.java)
+ val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_broadcast, container, false)
+ 
+ val spinner: Spinner = root.findViewById(R.id.broadcast_spinner)
+ val proceedButton: Button = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_proceed)
+ 
+ // Create an ArrayAdapter using the string array and a default spinner layout
+ ArrayAdapter.createFromResource(
+ requireContext(),
+ R.array.broadcast_types,
+ android.R.layout.simple_spinner_item
+ ).also { adapter ->
+ // Specify the layout to use when the list of choices appears
+ adapter.setDropDownViewResource(android.R.layout.simple_spinner_dropdown_item)
+ // Apply the adapter to the spinner
+ spinner.adapter = adapter
+ }
+ 
+ spinner.onItemSelectedListener = object : AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener {
+ override fun onItemSelected(parent: AdapterView<*>, view: View?, position: Int, id: Long) {
+ selectedBroadcastType = position
+ }
+
+ override fun onNothingSelected(parent: AdapterView<*>) {
+ selectedBroadcastType = 0
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ proceedButton.setOnClickListener {
+ when (selectedBroadcastType) {
+ 0 -> { // Custom broadcast receiver
+ val intent = Intent(activity, BroadcastSenderActivity::class.java)
+ startActivity(intent)
+ }
+ 1 -> { // System battery notification
+ val intent = Intent(activity, BroadcastReceiverActivity::class.java)
+ intent.putExtra("broadcast_type", "system_battery")
+ startActivity(intent)
+ }
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ return root
+ }
+}
```

+package com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast
 
+import android.content.Intent
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.widget.Button
+import android.widget.EditText
+import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
+import com.example.labass2.R
+
+class BroadcastSenderActivity : AppCompatActivity() {
+
+ override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
+ super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
+ setContentView(R.layout.activity_broadcast_sender)
+ 
+ val messageEditText: EditText = findViewById(R.id.edit_message)
+ val sendButton: Button = findViewById(R.id.btn_send)
+ 
+ sendButton.setOnClickListener {
+ val message = messageEditText.text.toString()
+ if (message.isNotEmpty()) {
+ // Start the receiver activity
+ val intent = Intent(this, BroadcastReceiverActivity::class.java)
+ intent.putExtra("broadcast_type", "custom")
+ intent.putExtra("message", message)
+ startActivity(intent)
+ }
+ }
+ }
+}
```

Now, let's create the BroadcastReceiverActivity:","tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01AHYH5SRxcCAJic7tV2h6Nf","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"code_edit": "package com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast\n\nimport android.content.BroadcastReceiver\nimport android.content.Context\nimport android.content.Intent\nimport android.content.IntentFilter\nimport android.os.BatteryManager\nimport android.os.Bundle\nimport android.widget.TextView\nimport androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity\nimport com.example.labass2.R\n\nclass BroadcastReceiverActivity : AppCompatActivity() {\n\n private lateinit var resultTextView: TextView\n private var broadcastType: String? = null\n private var batteryReceiver: BroadcastReceiver? = null\n \n override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {\n super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)\n setContentView(R.layout.activity_broadcast_receiver)\n \n resultTextView = findViewById(R.id.text_result)\n \n broadcastType = intent.getStringExtra(\"broadcast_type\")\n \n when (broadcastType) {\n \"custom\" -> {\n val message = intent.getStringExtra(\"message\")\n if (message != null) {\n resultTextView.text = getString(R.string.received_message, message)\n // Send a broadcast with the message\n sendCustomBroadcast(message)\n }\n }\n \"system_battery\" -> {\n // Register for battery updates\n registerBatteryReceiver()\n }\n }\n }\n \n private fun sendCustomBroadcast(message: String) {\n val intent = Intent(\"com.example.labass2.CUSTOM_ACTION\")\n intent.putExtra(\"message\", message)\n sendBroadcast(intent)\n }\n \n private fun registerBatteryReceiver() {\n batteryReceiver = object : BroadcastReceiver() {\n override fun onReceive(context: Context, intent: Intent) {\n val level = intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_LEVEL, -1)\n val scale = intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_SCALE, -1)\n val batteryPct = level * 100 / scale.toFloat()\n resultTextView.text = getString(R.string.battery_level, batteryPct.toInt())\n }\n }\n val filter = IntentFilter(Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED)\n registerReceiver(batteryReceiver, filter)\n }\n \n override fun onDestroy() {\n super.onDestroy()\n batteryReceiver?.let { unregisterReceiver(it) }\n }\n}", "instructions": "Creating the BroadcastReceiverActivity for both custom broadcasts and system battery broadcasts", "target_file": "app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/ui/broadcast/BroadcastReceiverActivity.kt"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01AHYH5SRxcCAJic7tV2h6Nf","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,1 +1,66 @@
+package com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast
 
+import android.content.BroadcastReceiver
+import android.content.Context
+import android.content.Intent
+import android.content.IntentFilter
+import android.os.BatteryManager
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.widget.TextView
+import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
+import com.example.labass2.R
+
+class BroadcastReceiverActivity : AppCompatActivity() {
+
+ private lateinit var resultTextView: TextView
+ private var broadcastType: String? = null
+ private var batteryReceiver: BroadcastReceiver? = null
+ 
+ override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
+ super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
+ setContentView(R.layout.activity_broadcast_receiver)
+ 
+ resultTextView = findViewById(R.id.text_result)
+ 
+ broadcastType = intent.getStringExtra("broadcast_type")
+ 
+ when (broadcastType) {
+ "custom" -> {
+ val message = intent.getStringExtra("message")
+ if (message != null) {
+ resultTextView.text = getString(R.string.received_message, message)
+ // Send a broadcast with the message
+ sendCustomBroadcast(message)
+ }
+ }
+ "system_battery" -> {
+ // Register for battery updates
+ registerBatteryReceiver()
+ }
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ private fun sendCustomBroadcast(message: String) {
+ val intent = Intent("com.example.labass2.CUSTOM_ACTION")
+ intent.putExtra("message", message)
+ sendBroadcast(intent)
+ }
+ 
+ private fun registerBatteryReceiver() {
+ batteryReceiver = object : BroadcastReceiver() {
+ override fun onReceive(context: Context, intent: Intent) {
+ val level = intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_LEVEL, -1)
+ val scale = intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_SCALE, -1)
+ val batteryPct = level * 100 / scale.toFloat()
+ resultTextView.text = getString(R.string.battery_level, batteryPct.toInt())
+ }
+ }
+ val filter = IntentFilter(Intent.ACTION_BATTERY_CHANGED)
+ registerReceiver(batteryReceiver, filter)
+ }
+ 
+ override fun onDestroy() {
+ super.onDestroy()
+ batteryReceiver?.let { unregisterReceiver(it) }
+ }
+}
```

@@ -1,1 +1,15 @@
+package com.example.labass2.ui.broadcast
 
+import android.content.BroadcastReceiver
+import android.content.Context
+import android.content.Intent
+import android.widget.Toast
+
+class CustomBroadcastReceiver : BroadcastReceiver() {
+ override fun onReceive(context: Context, intent: Intent) {
+ val message = intent.getStringExtra("message")
+ if (message != null) {
+ Toast.makeText(context, "Received broadcast: $message", Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show()
+ }
+ }
+}

Now let's implement the ImageScaleFragment for pinch-to-zoom functionality:","tool_calls":[{"id":"toolu_bdrk_01EKKoyuZaxfDv4YiYGvFrLv","type":"function","function":{"name":"edit_file","arguments":"{"code_edit": "package com.example.labass2.ui.image\n\nimport android.os.Bundle\nimport android.view.LayoutInflater\nimport android.view.ScaleGestureDetector\nimport android.view.View\nimport android.view.ViewGroup\nimport android.widget.ImageView\nimport androidx.fragment.app.Fragment\nimport androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider\nimport com.bumptech.glide.Glide\nimport com.example.labass2.R\n\nclass ImageScaleFragment : Fragment() {\n\n private lateinit var imageViewModel: ImageViewModel\n private lateinit var imageView: ImageView\n private lateinit var scaleGestureDetector: ScaleGestureDetector\n private var scaleFactor = 1.0f\n\n override fun onCreateView(\n inflater: LayoutInflater,\n container: ViewGroup?,\n savedInstanceState: Bundle?\n ): View? {\n imageViewModel =\n ViewModelProvider(this).get(ImageViewModel::class.java)\n val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_image_scale, container, false)\n \n imageView = root.findViewById(R.id.image_view)\n \n // Load image from internet\n Glide.with(this)\n .load(\"https://picsum.photos/800/600\")\n .placeholder(R.drawable.ic_menu_gallery)\n .into(imageView)\n \n // Configure pinch-to-zoom\n scaleGestureDetector = ScaleGestureDetector(context, ScaleListener())\n \n imageView.setOnTouchListener { v, event ->\n scaleGestureDetector.onTouchEvent(event)\n true\n }\n \n return root\n }\n \n private inner class ScaleListener : ScaleGestureDetector.SimpleOnScaleGestureListener() {\n override fun onScale(detector: ScaleGestureDetector): Boolean {\n scaleFactor *= detector.scaleFactor\n \n // Limit scaling\n scaleFactor = scaleFactor.coerceIn(0.5f, 3.0f)\n \n imageView.scaleX = scaleFactor\n imageView.scaleY = scaleFactor\n return true\n }\n }\n}", "instructions": "Creating the ImageScaleFragment for image scaling functionality", "target_file": "app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/ui/image/ImageScaleFragment.kt"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_bdrk_01EKKoyuZaxfDv4YiYGvFrLv","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,1 +1,61 @@
+package com.example.labass2.ui.image
 
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.ScaleGestureDetector
+import android.view.View
+import android.view.ViewGroup
+import android.widget.ImageView
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
+import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
+import com.bumptech.glide.Glide
+import com.example.labass2.R
+
+class ImageScaleFragment : Fragment() {
+
+ private lateinit var imageViewModel: ImageViewModel
+ private lateinit var imageView: ImageView
+ private lateinit var scaleGestureDetector: ScaleGestureDetector
+ private var scaleFactor = 1.0f
+
+ override fun onCreateView(
+ inflater: LayoutInflater,
+ container: ViewGroup?,
+ savedInstanceState: Bundle?
+ ): View? {
+ imageViewModel =
+ ViewModelProvider(this).get(ImageViewModel::class.java)
+ val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_image_scale, container, false)
+ 
+ imageView = root.findViewById(R.id.image_view)
+ 
+ // Load image from internet
+ Glide.with(this)
+ .load("https://picsum.photos/800/600")
+ .placeholder(R.drawable.ic_menu_gallery)
+ .into(imageView)
+ 
+ // Configure pinch-to-zoom
+ scaleGestureDetector = ScaleGestureDetector(context, ScaleListener())
+ 
+ imageView.setOnTouchListener { v, event ->
+ scaleGestureDetector.onTouchEvent(event)
+ true
+ }
+ 
+ return root
+ }
+ 
+ private inner class ScaleListener : ScaleGestureDetector.SimpleOnScaleGestureListener() {
+ override fun onScale(detector: ScaleGestureDetector): Boolean {
+ scaleFactor *= detector.scaleFactor
+ 
+ // Limit scaling
+ scaleFactor = scaleFactor.coerceIn(0.5f, 3.0f)
+ 
+ imageView.scaleX = scaleFactor
+ imageView.scaleY = scaleFactor
+ return true
+ }
+ }
+}
```

= null\n private lateinit var playerView: PlayerView\n \n // Sample video URL (replace with your video URL)\n private val videoUrl = \"https://storage.googleapis.com/exoplayer-test-media-0/BigBuckBunny_320x180.mp4\"\n \n override fun onCreateView(\n inflater: LayoutInflater,\n container: ViewGroup?,\n savedInstanceState: Bundle?\n ): View? {\n videoViewModel =\n ViewModelProvider(this).get(VideoViewModel::class.java)\n val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_video, container, false)\n \n playerView = root.findViewById(R.id.player_view)\n \n return root\n }\n \n override fun onStart() {\n super.onStart()\n if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {\n initializePlayer()\n }\n }\n\n override fun onResume() {\n super.onResume()\n if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23 || player == null) {\n initializePlayer()\n }\n }\n\n override fun onPause() {\n super.onPause()\n if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23) {\n releasePlayer()\n }\n }\n\n override fun onStop() {\n super.onStop()\n if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {\n releasePlayer()\n }\n }\n \n private fun initializePlayer() {\n player = ExoPlayer.Builder(requireContext())\n .build()\n .also { exoPlayer ->\n playerView.player = exoPlayer\n \n val mediaItem = MediaItem.fromUri(videoUrl)\n exoPlayer.setMediaItem(mediaItem)\n exoPlayer.prepare()\n exoPlayer.playWhenReady = true\n }\n }\n \n private fun releasePlayer() {\n player?.let { exoPlayer ->\n exoPlayer.release()\n }\n player = null\n }\n}", "instructions": "Creating the VideoFragment for video playback", "target_file": "app/src/main/java/com/example/labass2/ui/video/VideoFragment.kt"}"}}]},{"role":"tool","name":"edit_file","tool_call_id":"toolu_vrtx_01FTGDA9JmNZ81zLeQRon13k","content":"The apply model made the following changes to the file:

```
@@ -1,1 +1,85 @@
+package com.example.labass2.ui.video
 
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import android.view.ViewGroup
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
+import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
+import androidx.media3.common.MediaItem
+import androidx.media3.common.util.Util
+import androidx.media3.exoplayer.ExoPlayer
+import androidx.media3.ui.PlayerView
+import com.example.labass2.R
+
+class VideoFragment : Fragment() {
+
+ private lateinit var videoViewModel: VideoViewModel
+ private var player: ExoPlayer? = null
+ private lateinit var playerView: PlayerView
+ 
+ // Sample video URL (replace with your video URL)
+ private val videoUrl = "https://storage.googleapis.com/exoplayer-test-media-0/BigBuckBunny_320x180.mp4"
+ 
+ override fun onCreateView(
+ inflater: LayoutInflater,
+ container: ViewGroup?,
+ savedInstanceState: Bundle?
+ ): View? {
+ videoViewModel =
+ ViewModelProvider(this).get(VideoViewModel::class.java)
+ val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_video, container, false)
+ 
+ playerView = root.findViewById(R.id.player_view)
+ 
+ return root
+ }
+ 
+ override fun onStart() {
+ super.onStart()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
+ initializePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+
+ override fun onResume() {
+ super.onResume()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23 || player == null) {
+ initializePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+
+ override fun onPause() {
+ super.onPause()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23) {
+ releasePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+
+ override fun onStop() {
+ super.onStop()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
+ releasePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ private fun initializePlayer() {
+ player = ExoPlayer.Builder(requireContext())
+ .build()
+ .also { exoPlayer ->
+ playerView.player = exoPlayer
+ 
+ val mediaItem = MediaItem.fromUri(videoUrl)
+ exoPlayer.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
+ exoPlayer.prepare()
+ exoPlayer.playWhenReady = true
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ private fun releasePlayer() {
+ player?.let { exoPlayer ->
+ exoPlayer.release()
+ }
+ player = null
+ }
+}
```

+package com.example.labass2.ui.audio
 
+import android.os.Bundle
+import android.view.LayoutInflater
+import android.view.View
+import android.view.ViewGroup
+import android.widget.Button
+import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
+import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider
+import androidx.media3.common.MediaItem
+import androidx.media3.common.util.Util
+import androidx.media3.exoplayer.ExoPlayer
+import androidx.media3.ui.PlayerControlView
+import com.example.labass2.R
+
+class AudioFragment : Fragment() {
+
+ private lateinit var audioViewModel: AudioViewModel
+ private var player: ExoPlayer? = null
+ private lateinit var playerControlView: PlayerControlView
+ private lateinit var playButton: Button
+ private lateinit var pauseButton: Button
+ 
+ // Sample audio URL (replace with your audio URL)
+ private val audioUrl = "https://www.learningcontainer.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Kalimba.mp3"
+ 
+ override fun onCreateView(
+ inflater: LayoutInflater,
+ container: ViewGroup?,
+ savedInstanceState: Bundle?
+ ): View? {
+ audioViewModel =
+ ViewModelProvider(this).get(AudioViewModel::class.java)
+ val root = inflater.inflate(R.layout.fragment_audio, container, false)
+ 
+ playerControlView = root.findViewById(R.id.player_control_view)
+ playButton = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_play)
+ pauseButton = root.findViewById(R.id.btn_pause)
+ 
+ playButton.setOnClickListener {
+ player?.play()
+ }
+ 
+ pauseButton.setOnClickListener {
+ player?.pause()
+ }
+ 
+ return root
+ }
+ 
+ override fun onStart() {
+ super.onStart()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
+ initializePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+
+ override fun onResume() {
+ super.onResume()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23 || player == null) {
+ initializePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+
+ override fun onPause() {
+ super.onPause()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT <= 23) {
+ releasePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+
+ override fun onStop() {
+ super.onStop()
+ if (Util.SDK_INT > 23) {
+ releasePlayer()
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ private fun initializePlayer() {
+ player = ExoPlayer.Builder(requireContext())
+ .build()
+ .also { exoPlayer ->
+ playerControlView.player = exoPlayer
+ 
+ val mediaItem = MediaItem.fromUri(audioUrl)
+ exoPlayer.setMediaItem(mediaItem)
+ exoPlayer.prepare()
+ }
+ }
+ 
+ private fun releasePlayer() {
+ player?.let { exoPlayer ->
+ exoPlayer.release()
+ }
+ player = null
+ }
+}
```

```
@@ -1,1 +1,51 @@
+# Lab Assignment 2 - Android Development
 
+This Android application demonstrates various features including fragments, navigation drawer, broadcast receivers, image manipulation, and media playback.
+
+## Features
+
+### 1. Navigation Drawer
+The application uses a navigation drawer to navigate between different fragments.
+
+### 2. Broadcast Receiver
+- Shows a spinner to select different broadcast types:
+ - Custom broadcast receiver
+ - System battery notification receiver
+- Uses activities to send and receive broadcasts
+- Demonstrates how to register and handle broadcast receivers
+
+### 3. Image Scale
+- Loads an image from the internet using Glide
+- Implements pinch-to-zoom gesture for scaling the image
+
+### 4. Video Player
+- Plays a video using ExoPlayer
+- Provides media controls for video playback
+
+### 5. Audio Player
+- Plays audio using ExoPlayer
+- Provides media controls for audio playback
+
+## Implementation Notes
+
+### Broadcast Receiver Flow
+1. User selects a broadcast type in the BroadcastFragment
+2. For custom broadcast, the user enters a message in BroadcastSenderActivity
+3. The message is sent to BroadcastReceiverActivity, which then broadcasts it
+4. CustomBroadcastReceiver receives the broadcast and displays a toast
+
+For battery level monitoring, the application registers a receiver for battery changes and displays the current level.
+
+### Image Scaling
+Uses ScaleGestureDetector to detect pinch gestures and adjust the scaling of the image.
+
+### Media Playback
+Uses ExoPlayer library for both video and audio playback with proper lifecycle management.
+
+## Libraries Used
+- AndroidX Navigation Components for drawer navigation
+- Glide for image loading and caching
+- ExoPlayer for media playback
+
+## Credits
+This application was created as a lab assignment for Android development course.
```"},{"role":"assistant","content":"

## Summary of Implementation

I've implemented all the required components for your Android assignment:

1. **Broadcast Receiver**
 - Created BroadcastFragment with a spinner to select between custom and system battery broadcast receivers
 - Implemented BroadcastSenderActivity for sending custom broadcasts
 - Implemented BroadcastReceiverActivity for receiving both types of broadcasts
 - Added CustomBroadcastReceiver to handle broadcast intents

2. **Image Scale**
 - Implemented ImageScaleFragment with pinch-to-zoom functionality
 - Added Glide for loading images from the internet
 - Used ScaleGestureDetector for handling pinch gestures

3. **Video Playback**
 - Created VideoFragment using ExoPlayer for video playback
 - Added proper lifecycle management for the player

4. **Audio Playback**
 - Implemented AudioFragment with play/pause controls
 - Used ExoPlayer for audio playback

All these components are accessible through the navigation drawer, as required.

There might be some compilation issues due to dependency resolution that would need to be fixed:
- Make sure the ExoPlayer MediaPlayer dependencies are correctly added to build.gradle
- Make sure activities are registered in AndroidManifest.xml

To finalize the implementation:
1. Register the activities in AndroidManifest.xml
2. Fix any dependency issues with ExoPlayer or Glide
3. Test each component to ensure proper functionality

The code structure follows the Android Jetpack design philosophy with ViewModel and Fragment patterns, as requested in the assignment."}]}

I've added the `@UnstableApi` annotation to your VideoFragment class. This annotation tells the compiler that you acknowledge you're using APIs that are marked as unstable in the Media3 library.

The Media3 library (which includes ExoPlayer) has many components that are marked as unstable, meaning they might change in future releases. By adding the `@UnstableApi` annotation to your class, you're explicitly opting into using these unstable APIs.

This should resolve the error you were seeing. The annotation informs both the compiler and other developers that your code deliberately uses these unstable APIs and might need updates if these APIs change in future Media3 releases.

If you prefer to use `@OptIn` instead, you could alternatively use:
```kotlin
@OptIn(UnstableApi::class)
class VideoFragment : Fragment() {
 // Your code
}
```

Both approaches will resolve the error."}]}
